# ggplot2

- "The grammar of graphics": 3 components make a graph
  + dataset
  + coordinate system
  + geometries ("geoms"): visual marks representing data points


![image](figures/ggplot_logic_1.png)

---
# ggplot2
- geom's have properties which are called "aesthetics"
  + size
  + color
  + x, y


![image](figures/ggplot_logic_2.png)

# Histogram

.pull-left[
```{r, histogram1, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}

ggplot(data=penguins) +
  aes(bill_length_mm) +
  geom_histogram() + 
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'histogram1', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]

---
# Distinguishing species via colors

.pull-left[
```{r, histogram2, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}

ggplot(data=penguins) +
  aes(bill_length_mm) +
  geom_histogram(        #<<
    aes(fill = species)  #<<
    ) +                  #<<
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'histogram2', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]

---
# Adding kernel density and rug plots

.pull-left[
```{r, histogram3, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}

ggplot(data=penguins) +
  aes(bill_length_mm) +
  geom_histogram(
    aes(
      fill = species,
      y = ..density..       #<<
      ),                    #<<
    alpha=0.3               #<<
    ) +                     #<<
  geom_density(             #<<
    aes(                    #<<
      color = species)      #<<
    ) +                     #<<
  geom_rug(aes(color=species)) + #<<
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'histogram3', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]

```{r, scatterplot1, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}
  theme_xaringan()
```

# Add regression lines

.pull-left[
```{r, scatterplot1.1, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
      y = bill_depth_mm) +
  geom_point(size = 2) +
  geom_smooth(method="lm", 
              color="blue") + 
  geom_smooth(method="loess", 
              color="orange") + 
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'scatterplot1.1', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]

# Distinguishing species via colors

.pull-left[
```{r, scatterplot2, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins) +

  theme_xaringan()
```
]

# Add regression lines
- Simpson's paradox: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simpson%27s_paradox

.pull-left[
```{r, scatterplot3, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  aes(x = bill_length_mm, 
      y = bill_depth_mm) +
  geom_point(
    aes(color = species, 
        shape = species),
    size = 2
    ) + 
  geom_smooth(           #<<
    method = "lm",       #<<
    se = TRUE,           #<<
    aes(color = species) #<<
    ) +                  #<<
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'scatterplot3', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]

# Violinplot

.pull-left[
```{r, violinplot, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE}
ggplot(data = penguins) +
  aes(x = species, 
      y = bill_length_mm) +
  geom_violin(alpha=.5) + 
  geom_jitter(shape=16, position=position_jitter(0.2), color="red", alpha=0.5) + 
  geom_boxplot(width=0.1) +
  theme_xaringan()
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r ref.label = 'violinplot', echo = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
```
]
